item.title: Dana add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "There ain't no devil, only God when he's drunk." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Dana add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The very existence of flamethrowers proves that sometime, somewhere, someone said to themselves, 'You know, I want to set those people over there on fire, but Iâ€™m just not close enough to get the job done." -- George Carlin

item.title: Dana add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Those who dance are considered insane by those who cannot hear the music." -- George Carlin

item.title: Dana add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Dana add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "The story comes around, pushing at our brains, and soon we are trying to ravel back to the beginning, trying to put families into order and make sense of things. But we start with one person, and soon another and another follows, and still another, until we are lost in the connections." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Dana add a quote by Dana M. Baird
item.description: "The Folklore process is like playing a centuries-long game of "telephone." -- Dana M. Baird
